source: Add a "Select All/None" link when rendering the exposed filter using checkboxes. If this option is disabled, edit the filter and check the "Allow multiple selections".
Add select all/none links to hierarchical lists
Adds a "Reset sort" link; Views will use the default sort order.

Allows you to specify some exposed form elements as being secondary options and places those elements in a collapsible "details" element. Use this option to place some exposed filters in an "Advanced Search" area of the form, for example.
Automatically submits the form when an element has changed.
BEF provides some additional HTML structure to help you style your exposed filters. For some common examples see the online documentation.

Better Exposed Filters (BEF) modifies the use of Views by replacing the 'single' or 'multi' select boxes with radio buttons or checkboxes. Views offers the ability to expose filters to the end user. When you expose a filter, you allow the user to interact with the view making it easy to build an advanced search. Better Exposed Filters gives you greater control over the rendering of exposed filters. For more information, see the online documentation for the Better Exposed Filters module.

Better Exposed Filters is used on Views that use an exposed filter. Views filters are used to reduce the result set of a View to a manageable amount of data. BEF only operates on fields that have a limited number of options such as Node:Type or Taxonomy:TermID.
Combine sort order with sort by

Combines the sort by options and order (ascending or decending) into a single list. Use this to display "Option1 (ascending)", "Option1 (descending)", "Option2 (ascending)", "Option2 (descending)" in a single form element. Sort order should first be exposed by selecting Allow people to choose the sort order.
Configure a delay in ms before triggering autosubmit on textfields.
Determines the size or amount of each interval or step the slider takes between the min and max.
Enable the Token module to allow token replacement in this field.
Exclude textfields from auto-submit. User will have to press enter key, or click submit button.
Global replacement patterns (for description field only)
Hides submit button if auto-submit and javascript are enabled.
Indicates whether the details element should be open by default.
No pager elements have been exposed yet.
No sort elements have been exposed yet.
Only display results after the user has selected a filter option
Only display results after the user has selected a filter option.
Places this element in the secondary options portion of the exposed form.
Provides additional options for exposed form elements.
Provides advanced options (e.g. links, checkboxes, or other widgets) to exposed Views elements.
Puts the filter options in a collapsible details element.
Puts the sort options in a collapsible details element.
Select a format for the exposed pager options.
Select a format for the exposed sort options.
Text format for the text_input_required field
Text shown if a filter option has not been selected
Text to be shown in the text field until it is edited. Leave blank for no placeholder to be set.
The full specified value range of the slider (Range maximum - Range minimum) must be evenly divisible by the step.
The maximum allowed value for the jQuery range slider. It can be positive, negative, or zero and have up to 11 decimal places.
The minimum allowed value for the jQuery range slider. It can be positive, negative, or zero and have up to 11 decimal places.
The name of the details element to hold secondary options. This cannot be left blank or there will be no way to show/hide these options.
The number of milliseconds to run the animation (e.g. 1000).
The options will be sorted alphabetically.
The orientation of the jQuery range slider.
The slider max value must be greater than the slider min value.
The slider range must be evenly divisible by the step option.
The slider step option for %name cannot have more than 5 decimal places.
The step must be a positive number of up to 5 decimal places.
This cannot be left blank if the above option is checked
This cannot be left blank or there will be no way to show/hide sort options.
This filter is a secondary option

This section lets you select additional options for exposed filters. Some options are only available in certain situations. If you do not see the options you expect, please see the BEF settings documentation page for more details.

This section lets you select additional options for exposed pagers. Some options are only available in certain situations. If you do not see the options you expect, please see the BEF settings documentation page for more details.

This section lets you select additional options for exposed sorts. Some options are only available in certain situations. If you do not see the options you expect, please see the BEF settings documentation page for more details.
Tokens are allowed in this field. Replacement options can be found in the "Global replacement patterns" section, below.

Use this field to rewrite the filter options displayed. Use the format of current_text|replacement_text, one replacement per line. For example: 
  Current|Replacement
  On|Yes
  Off|No
Leave the replacement text blank to remove an option altogether. If using hierarchical taxonomy filters, do not including leading hyphens in the current text.

Use this field to rewrite the text displayed for combined sort options and sort order. Use the format of current_text|replacement_text, one replacement per line. For example: 
Post date Asc|Oldest first
Post date Desc|Newest first
Title Asc|A -> Z
Title Desc|Z -> A
Leave the replacement text blank to remove an option altogether. The order the options appear will be changed to match the order of options in this field.

When a parent checkbox is checked, check all its children. If this option is disabled, edit the filter and check "Allow multiple selections" and edit the filter settings and check "Show hierarchy in dropdown".
Whether to slide handle smoothly when user click outside handle on the bar.
